Description: Wall fragment of a pottery closed vessel; cream slip on outside; animal frieze: body back of animal, horn of a grazing wild goat to the left; purple dot on the flank of the first animal. Hard, yellow/light brown clay, Munsell 10YR 7/3 (very pale brown), dark inclusions, little mica, lime inclusions.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Findspot number '18' scratched onto the reverse side of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 316)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
